name: Beamish Hall Hotel

reviews.text: Myself and a colleague stayed for two nights at this hotel. I cannot speak highly enough of the value and high standards of the accomodation. The rooms were individual and extremely clean. Breakfast was great and no one rushed us ( even when we were the last to leave ) The Stables restaurant offered a varied menu which was low in cost but high in quality. The staff were very friendly and professional. It is a hotel with real character and a relaxing ambiance. I would definately recommend a stay for business or pleasure.
reviews.title: A very pleasant business trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms reflect the age and history of this former stately home; with a very modern bathroom. It is like stepping back in time. If you want a piece of history (built 1268) in beautiful grounds look no further. All the staff were professional and friendly. Being a real ale fan I loved the Stables bar and restaurant that sells approx 10 beers brewed on site at the hotel's microbrewery. A must for any real ale fan. We ate in the Stables restaurant - and were very impressed with the high quality of food and value for money. Breakfast in the Eden room was an experience, again great food in a beautiful period ballroom. I thoroughly recommend this hotel (and we didn't see any of its many ghosts!). My wife and I will definately be going back.
reviews.title: A Beautiful Hotel In Tranquil Setting

reviews.text: Myself and a colleague stayed here for 4 days while we were working in the area. I had an excellent week but my colleague was not so impressed. This was not the hotels fault in any way, it was just the fact that he was terrified at the idea of possibly seeing a ghost lol. The staff were very friendly and helpful as were the bar staff in the stables bar which is part of the hotel. The hotel is a bit out of the way but excellent location for the birds of prey center, going wild adventure park and Beamish living history museum. If you like real ale I would recommend silver buckles bitter served in the stables bar.
reviews.title: Enjoyable haunted stay

reviews.text: Would I stay again, yes I would. But I am not sure my colleague would.
reviews.title: Good food, good service in wonderful surroundings

reviews.text: Perhaps I told him to many ghost stories :)
reviews.title: Good times

reviews.text: Met a couple of friends here for dinner. Very impressed by the surroundings. Nice choice of food and impeccable service. Outside bar looked interesting for the summer.
reviews.title: Stables Bar is excellent

reviews.text: Had a lovely few days here, the hotel is set in very pretty countryside and is peaceful and quiet. We stayed in a deluxe double that was tastefully finished in classical country house style. The room had everything you would expect, was clean and big enough to fit in a large travel cot.
reviews.title: Good value stay - great place to eat/drink !
A thoroughly nice day
reviews.text: The staff was welcoming, approachable and were able to help us with any requests. When things were not right - the freeview box was broken (not in its own right a big issue but vital to our grumpy and tired toddler who wanted a little cbeebies before bedtime!) they dealt with it quickly and in a friendly manner.
Good breakfast with lots of choice and showcasing the best of local produce.
reviews.title: SUPERB WEDDING VENUE.

reviews.text: For us the highlight was the Stables restaurant, the beers from the microbrewery were excellent and the food was wholesome & tasty. The menu offered a good range of choices - think good quality pub grub rather than fine dining - I would recommend the beef and Beamish Ale pie which was excellent! They also offer a good children’s menu which has lots of options and offers freshly made foods rather than the predictable deep-fried ‘freezer food’ you normally see on the kids menu!
reviews.title: 5* Staff, and a full vegetarian breakfast offered - wow!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beamish Hall is a hotel I have stayed at with my Wife on a couple of occasions - and regularly visit the Stables Bar for food / Drink. My most recent stay was for the winter beer festival which was fantastic. The rooms are of a good standard for the money, although rooms in the same category can be quite different size and location. If you are not happy with the first room you are allocated it is worth asking to look at another which you may find is more to your satisfaction. The Hotel is very convinient for a visit to Beamish museum, which is a day out not to be missed if you are in the North East.
reviews.title: Beautiful Historic hotel - Excellent Beer Festival

reviews.text: I have just visited for the 1st and I hope not my last time to Beamish Hall and found it to be a mixture of history and lack of design and comfort, all which made the visit 3 star at best.
reviews.title: Stunning, historic, but avoid room 211

reviews.text: The reception is placed in a room which has 14 chesterfield sofas /chairs, but is oddly positioned at the bottom on the stairs, like a 20th Century after thought. Shame.
reviews.title: Long wait and disappointing food at The Stables

reviews.text: Room 211 a classic room. The en-suite has determined where the bed goes, a magnificent mahogany head board and frame, which with all the other historic items, pictures, suit of armour and wall hanging, exude the history of the place, but sadly, as I discovered on the first night, so does the lumpy mattress and small pillows. Worse, the bed only just fits in the en-suite determine room and there are 6 -12 inches of space with the wall, making it interesting to stand up when you get out of the left side of the bed.
reviews.title: Distinctly average lunch at The Stables

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room has two windows, with long drapes and poor lighting. No lamps anywhere to gather extra light. The huge wardrobe and beautiful desk are in the room, but two poorly provisioned (uncomfortable) easy chairs, just get in the way. There is a suit case holder, in a space so small that it is unusable.
reviews.title: lovely night

reviews.text: This Country House Hotel is not the type I usually stay at on business, but it was convenient for my next day meeting. What a nice place. What nice people.
reviews.title: Looking forward to staying here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed with my wife, who was also on business and it was a very rare occasion that we both had business in the same area. This hotel is not far away from the main A1 route, and I am surprised that it was so empty of guests. Perhaps it has yet to be discovered. Come to think of it, perhaps I should stop here, and stop waxing so lyrical and making it more popular.
reviews.title: It is perfectly nice, just missing the WOW factor for me...

reviews.text: Anyway, we had a deluxe room and it was just very nice. Not a modern boutique hotel room by a long way, but comfortable, well furnished with period furniture and the usual hound and classical figures pictures and freezes you see in National Trust Houses. I didn't have time to explore the grounds and that’s why I intend to return. They look great. Just the thing to stroll around after a hard day’s work in the summer.
reviews.title: Quiet, relaxing retreat

reviews.text: The bathroom was fantastic. Great shower that works, and adjusts easily and a Jacuzzi for the languid amongst us. Internet access is a little primitive as they use cables and there could be more electrical sockets for all of the electronic paraphernalia that we need to operate and charge these days, but a small price to pay for a view across the gardens and sound of birdsong.
reviews.title: Afternoon tea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had dinner in the adjourning Saddlers restaurant, which is reached via an open courtyard. The food was nice, the real beer was very nice, and the service warm and efficient. Breakfast the next day was in the main body of the hotel. Perfectly cooked and perfectly served.
reviews.title: Lovely stay

description: This 17th-century listed hall is set in 24 acres of parkland, just 5 miles from the A1(M)Junction 63. Beamish Hall is situated halfway between the City of Durham (8 miles) and the City of Newcastle upon Tyne (8 miles). Beamish Hall is next door to Beamish Museum - The North of England's Open Air Museum. Close to the Gateshead Metro Centre Shopping Centre and many more alternative attractions for you to visit.
